item.title: The PlayStation Portal Remote Player is back in stock at most retailers now
item.description: Want to snag the PlayStation Portal Remote Player? It's finally available at multiple retailers right now.

item.title: Michael Cohen, key witness against Trump, takes the stand to testify at trial
item.description: On the stand, Michael Cohen told jurors about the decade he spent working for Trump as his self-described "fixer" and attorney.

item.title: Hundreds of thousands forced to flee again as Israel pushes into Rafah
item.description: Israel's battle against Hamas has forced nearly 360,000 people to flee from a city they were told only months ago to seek refuge in.

item.title: How likely are further restrictions on U.S. military aid to Israel?
item.description: Over the weekend, the U.S. leveled some of its strongest criticism yet of Israel's actions in Gaza, with U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken telling "Face the Nation," "In certain instances, Israel acted in ways that are not consistent with international humanitarian law." CBS News senior White House correspondent Weijia Jiang has more on the diplomatic relationship between the two countries.

item.title: Harry and Meghan wrap up a very royal looking tour of Nigeria
item.description: The Duke and Duchess of Sussex were warmly welcomed in Nigeria, where they wielded celebrity status even as former "working royals."

item.title: Screaming leads workers to tiger footprints, victim's body
item.description: A team was deployed to search for the critically endangered cat after a man was found dead with wounds indicating a tiger attack.

item.title: John Krasinski on how fatherhood inspired latest movie,"IF"
item.description: Writer, director, and actor John Krasinski declared his latest film, "IF," is his most personal project to date.

item.title: Sleep soundly with up to $800 off a mattress and base combo during the Purple Memorial Day Sale
item.description: Fall asleep and stay asleep with the perfect Purple mattress built to accommodate you and your unique needs.

item.title: Assistant school principal among 4 arrested in cold case triple murder
item.description: All three victims were tortured and killed before their bodies were put into a 2010 Dodge Charger, authorities said.

item.title: Will gold's price rise after this week's inflation report?
item.description: The new inflation report will be released on May 15. Here's how that could affect the price of gold.

item.title: 2 Americans among 20 arrested at protest over nation of Georgia's future
item.description: Thousands of people in Georgia are worried about what they see as their government's effort to let the Caucasus nation "slowly become Russia."

item.title: Prince Harry and Meghan travel to Nigeria to promote the Invictus Games
item.description: As Prince Harry and Meghan travel to Nigeria to support the Invictus Games, their latest efforts underline the complexities of royal life and personal reconciliation.

item.title: Canadian town bracing for out-of-control wildfire
item.description: The town's mayor warned residents who haven't evacuated may "find that the resources that they need are gone" if they fail to leave before the Parker Lake Wildfire arrives.

item.title: Mercedes-Benz workers in Alabama begin union vote
item.description: More than 5,000 Mercedes-Benz workers in Alabama will begin voting this week on joining the United Auto Workers union. CBS News correspondent Tom Hanson has the latest.

item.title: Author Harlan Coben on what inspired new book, "Think Twice"
item.description: Harlan Coben is the author of over 30 suspense novels. He has over 80 million books in print worldwide. He is out with his next book called "Think Twice." Coben joins "CBS Mornings" to talk about what inspired writing "Think Twice" and why he decided to bring back his very popular character, Myron Bolitar.

item.title: Jennifer Hudson talks success and renewal of her talk show
item.description: EGOT winner Jennifer Hudson joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss the renewal of "The Jennifer Hudson Show" for a third season and its four Daytime Emmy nominations.

item.title: "CBS Mornings" co-host Gayle King welcomes new granddaughter
item.description: "CBS Mornings" co-host Gayle King announced the birth of her granddaughter Grayson on Instagram, marking the occasion as the "best Mother's Day ever."

item.title: John Krasinski on why "IF" is his most personal movie yet
item.description: Writer, director and actor John Krasinski joins "CBS Mornings" to discuss his new movie "IF," a film about imaginary friends inspired by his daughters.

item.title: Tulane University's innovative wheelchair program secures additional funding
item.description: A few months ago, "CBS Mornings" lead national correspondent David Begnaud introduced viewers to an innovative architect in New Orleans and some college students at Tulane University who have found a way to provide life-changing wheelchairs to kids who really need them, all for free. Since he first shared their story, more donations have rolled in, and then something even more incredible happened.

item.title: Influencers promote raw milk despite warnings as bird flu raises risk
item.description: Interest in raw milk is rising in the U.S., fueled by both "wellness" and conservative influencers on social media â€” even though it can make people very sick.

item.title: Michael Cohen gets his day on stand in Trump criminal trial
item.description: Donald Trump's former personal lawyer Michael Cohen is set to testify Monday in the former president's criminal trial over alleged falsified business records to cover up a "hush money" payment to Stormy Daniels. CBS News' Graham Kates and Katrina Kaufman have more.

item.title: More geomagnetic storms likely to continue today
item.description: The forecasted conditions come after a weekend of jaw-dropping northern lights seen as far south as Florida and as "magnetically complex" sunspots bigger than Earth continue to emit solar flares.

item.title: How to save money on buying products that other shoppers return
item.description: The National Retail Federation estimates $743 billion worth of merchandise was returned last year. Buyers and sellers can't wait to get their hands on the products at bin stores, where the rejected items of others get a second lease on life, for a fraction of the price.

item.title: NYC museum curator allegedly tried to smuggle scorpion, spider samples
item.description: Lorenzo Prendini allegedly tried to take about 1,500 samples out of the country, news outlets reported.

item.title: FDA says it never inspected lab that made controversial device intended to fix patients' jaws
item.description: Documents show a dental lab that made a device that was supposed to help patients with TMJ jaw disorder was never inspected by the FDA before a CBS News and KFF Health News investigation. Numerous patients have said the "anterior growth guidance appliance," or AGGA, damaged their mouths. The device's inventor, dentist Dr. Steve Galella, claimed it could cure TMJ jaw disorder and sleep apnea. The device and its inventor are under criminal investigation. They have denied wrongdoing. Anna Werner reports.

item.title: Jury selection begins in Sen. Bob Menendez's federal corruption trial in New Jersey
item.description: Jury selection begins Monday for Sen. Bob Menendez's federal corruption trial. The New Jersey Democrat and his wife are accused of accepting gold bars and other gifts in exchange for favors for foreign governments. Menendez maintains he did not break the law.

item.title: Memorial Day weekend expected to be busiest for travel in nearly 20 years, AAA says
item.description: AAA expects a record number of drivers for Memorial Day weekend and airlines anticipate a potential record number of flyers as 43.8 million people are projected to travel 50 miles or more for the holiday.

item.title: Pressure grows on Netanyahu's government in Israel as thousands of Gazans flee Rafah
item.description: Nearly 360,000 Gazans have fled the city of Rafah as pressure increases on Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's government to come up with a plan to help solve the humanitarian crisis.

item.title: Ex-Trump attorney Michael Cohen expected to take stand in former president's criminal trial
item.description: Donald Trump's former attorney Michael Cohen is expected to testify at the former president's New York criminal trial on Monday.

item.title: Eye Opener: Michael Cohen to testify about Stormy Daniels payment inTrump criminal trial
item.description: Former Trump fixer Michael Cohen will testify about how he paid Stormy Daniels. Also, more extreme weather is coming to the South after a weekend of powerful storms produced more tornadoes. All that and all that matters in today's Eye Opener.
